column5: I had made plans to take my dad out for lakers, and I got a call a few nights ago from some clients asking to go the same day.  They didnt mind the extra company so we all headed out in search of some trout.  The day started a little late, setting up shop at around 8:30am in 90feet of water.  The snow got heavy and the fish were moving through pretty good but not showing a lot of interest.  Dropped spoons, bad boyz, jiggin raps, laker takers to no avail.  Around 9:30, one client called for help as I was in the other hut.  Arrived to see his rod buckled as he was doing battle with his first lake trout.  I saw it flash and knew it was a good fish.  Got it to the hole and into his hands, an 11 pound thing of beauty.  The fish was not able to be released unfortunately, but it wont be put to waste as his wife was happy to hear of the catch hahaha.  For the next 3 hours, the fishing was pretty steady and between the 4 of us we put 10 more through the hole.  Most of the fish were taken on my zonker jig, but 2 on a laker taker and 1 on a tube.  The bite slowed at around 1pm and we missed a few hits and called it a day at around 4pm and we all headed home happy.  Good day out!
Nice Steve But what's up with the glowing faces on the last pic    Looks like they're from outer space Nice of you to take your dad out!!! Thanks for sharing Leechman
nice catch!! I want to go to Simcoe some time.
nice catch how long did the ear to ear grins last? frozen teeth dont feel to good--LOL
probably covered their faces because they called in sick for work that day!

Always enjoy your reports steve! specially with those amazin' lookin' lakers! gotta get me some of them things!  Get out there and get some more fish! lakers, pike, walleye.... who cares! lol just go get some more man!  great job by the way!
